Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can skillfully draw various animals and plants, including an accurately represented fish, within a vibrant and well-detailed drawing.
The student can clearly show and label the habitat where the fish and other animals or plants live, such as an ocean, pond, or river, using precise terminology.
The student can accurately identify and label the resources fish and other living things need to survive, such as clean water, air, and specific plant types.
The student can demonstrate the relationship between fish and water, including labels and drawings that illustrate how fish rely on water for swimming and survival.
The student can show how the habitat provides the necessary resources for fish and other living things to thrive, including drawings and labels of sunlight, plants, and appropriate shelter.
The student can depict patterns indicating how living things, such as fish in water or plants needing sunlight, are adapted to their environments.
The student can explain through their drawing how the fish and its environment function as part of an interconnected system, including most interactions and dependencies.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally omit or partially label some details, leading to minor incomplete information (e.g., not labeling all plant types in the habitat).
The student might depict certain living thing interactions with slight oversimplifications (e.g., showing only a single predator-prey relation without broader ecosystem dynamics).
